verses.verseString: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: In the name of Allah, the Compassionate, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: حم
verses.verseStringB: Beneficent God!

verses.verseString: تَنْزِيلُ الْكِتَابِ مِنَ اللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَكِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: The revelation of the Book is from Allāh, the Mighty, the Wise.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ لَآيَاتٍ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely in the heavens and the earth are signs for believers.

verses.verseString: وَفِي خَلْقِكُمْ وَمَا يَبُثُّ مِنْ دَابَّةٍ آيَاتٌ لِقَوْمٍ يُوقِنُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And in your creation and in the animals He spreads abroad are signs for a people who are sure;

verses.verseString: وَاخْتِلَافِ اللَّيْلِ وَالنَّهَارِ وَمَا أَنْزَلَ اللَّهُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مِنْ رِزْقٍ فَأَحْيَا بِهِ الْأَرْضَ بَعْدَ مَوْتِهَا وَتَصْرِيفِ الرِّيَاحِ آيَاتٌ لِقَوْمٍ يَعْقِلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And (in) the variation of the night and the day and (in) the sustenance which Allāh sends down from the heaven, then gives life thereby to the earth after its death, and (in) the chang ing of the winds, are signs for a people who understand.

verses.verseString: تِلْكَ آيَاتُ اللَّهِ نَتْلُوهَا عَلَيْكَ بِالْحَقِّ ۖ فَبِأَيِّ حَدِيثٍ بَعْدَ اللَّهِ وَآيَاتِهِ يُؤْمِنُونَ
verses.verseStringB: These are the messages of Allāh, which We recite to thee with truth. In what announcement will they then believe after Allāh and His signs?ᵃ

verses.verseString: وَيْلٌ لِكُلِّ أَفَّاكٍ أَثِيمٍ
verses.verseStringB: Woe to every sinful liar!

verses.verseString: يَسْمَعُ آيَاتِ اللَّهِ تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ثُمَّ يُصِرُّ مُسْتَكْبِرًا كَأَنْ لَمْ يَسْمَعْهَا ۖ فَبَشِّرْهُ بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
verses.verseStringB: Who hears the messages of Allāh recited to him then persists in haughtiness, as though he had not heard them. So announce to him a painful chastisement.

verses.verseString: وَإِذَا عَلِمَ مِنْ آيَاتِنَا شَيْئًا اتَّخَذَهَا هُزُوًا ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ مُهِينٌ
verses.verseStringB: And when he comes to know of any of Our messages, he takes them for a jest. For such is an abasing chastisement.

verses.verseString: مِنْ وَرَائِهِمْ جَهَنَّمُ ۖ وَلَا يُغْنِي عَنْهُمْ مَا كَسَبُوا شَيْئًا وَلَا مَا اتَّخَذُوا مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ أَوْلِيَاءَ ۖ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: In front of them is hell, and that which they have earned will avail them naught, nor those whom they take for protectors besides Allāh, and for them is a grievous chastisement.

verses.verseString: هَٰذَا هُدًى ۖ وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ مِنْ رِجْزٍ أَلِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: This is guidance; and those who disbelieve in the messages of their Lord, for them is a painful chastisement of an evil (kind).

verses.verseString: اللَّهُ الَّذِي سَخَّرَ لَكُمُ الْبَحْرَ لِتَجْرِيَ الْفُلْكُ فِيهِ بِأَمْرِهِ وَلِتَبْتَغُوا مِنْ فَضْلِهِ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Allāh is He Who made subservient to you the sea that the ships may glide therein by His command, and that you may seek of His grace, and that you may give thanks.

verses.verseString: وَسَخَّرَ لَكُمْ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ جَمِيعًا مِنْهُ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَاتٍ لِقَوْمٍ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And He has made subservient to you whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth, all, from Himself. Surely there are signs in this for a people who reflect.

verses.verseString: قُلْ لِلَّذِينَ آمَنُوا يَغْفِرُوا لِلَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ أَيَّامَ اللَّهِ لِيَجْزِيَ قَوْمًا بِمَا كَانُوا يَكْسِبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Tell those who believe to forgive those who fear not the days of Allāha that He may reward a people for what they earn.

verses.verseString: مَنْ عَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَلِنَفْسِهِ ۖ وَمَنْ أَسَاءَ فَعَلَيْهَا ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكُمْ تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Whoever does good it is for himself, and whoever does evil, it is against himself; then to your Lord you will be brought back.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ الْكِتَابَ وَالْحُكْمَ وَالنُّبُوَّةَ وَرَزَقْنَاهُمْ مِنَ الطَّيِّبَاتِ وَفَضَّلْنَاهُمْ عَلَى الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And certainly We gave the Children of Israel the Book and judgment and prophethood and provided them with good things, and made them excel the nations.

verses.verseString: وَآتَيْنَاهُمْ بَيِّنَاتٍ مِنَ الْأَمْرِ ۖ فَمَا اخْتَلَفُوا إِلَّا مِنْ بَعْدِ مَا جَاءَهُمُ الْعِلْمُ بَغْيًا بَيْنَهُمْ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقْضِي بَيْنَهُمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ فِيمَا كَانُوا فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And We gave them clear arguments in the Affair.ᵃ So they differed not until after knowledge had come to them, out of envy among themselves. Surely thy Lord will judge between them on the day of Resurrection concerning that wherein they differed.

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَاكَ عَلَىٰ شَرِيعَةٍ مِنَ الْأَمْرِ فَاتَّبِعْهَا وَلَا تَتَّبِعْ أَهْوَاءَ الَّذِينَ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Then We made thee follow a course in the Affair, so follow it, and follow not the low desires of those who know not.

verses.verseString: إِنَّهُمْ لَنْ يُغْنُوا عَنْكَ مِنَ اللَّهِ شَيْئًا ۚ وَإِنَّ الظَّالِمِينَ بَعْضُهُمْ أَوْلِيَاءُ بَعْضٍ ۖ وَاللَّهُ وَلِيُّ الْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely they can avail thee naught against Allāh. And surely the wrongdoers are friends of each other, and Allāh is the Friend of the dutiful.

verses.verseString: هَٰذَا بَصَائِرُ لِلنَّاسِ وَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةٌ لِقَوْمٍ يُوقِنُونَ
verses.verseStringB: These are clear proofs for men, and a guidance and a mercy for a people who are sure.

verses.verseString: أَمْ حَسِبَ الَّذِينَ اجْتَرَحُوا السَّيِّئَاتِ أَنْ نَجْعَلَهُمْ كَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ سَوَاءً مَحْيَاهُمْ وَمَمَاتُهُمْ ۚ سَاءَ مَا يَحْكُمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Or do those who do evil deeds think that We shall make them as those who believe and do good — their life and their death being equal?ᵃ Evil is what they judge!

verses.verseString: وَخَلَقَ اللَّهُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ بِالْحَقِّ وَلِتُجْزَىٰ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ بِمَا كَسَبَتْ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And Allāh created the heavens and the earth with truth, and that every soul may be rewarded for what it has earned, and they will not be wronged.

verses.verseString: أَفَرَأَيْتَ مَنِ اتَّخَذَ إِلَٰهَهُ هَوَاهُ وَأَضَلَّهُ اللَّهُ عَلَىٰ عِلْمٍ وَخَتَمَ عَلَىٰ سَمْعِهِ وَقَلْبِهِ وَجَعَلَ عَلَىٰ بَصَرِهِ غِشَاوَةً فَمَنْ يَهْدِيهِ مِنْ بَعْدِ اللَّهِ ۚ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Seest thou him who takes his desire for his god, and Allāh leaves him in error knowingly,ᵃ and seals his hearing and his heart and puts a cover - ing on his sight? Who can then guide him after Allāh? Will you not mind?

verses.verseString: وَقَالُوا مَا هِيَ إِلَّا حَيَاتُنَا الدُّنْيَا نَمُوتُ وَنَحْيَا وَمَا يُهْلِكُنَا إِلَّا الدَّهْرُ ۚ وَمَا لَهُمْ بِذَٰلِكَ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا يَظُنُّونَ
verses.verseStringB: And they say: There is naught but our life of the world; we die and we live and nothing destroys us but time, and they have no knowledge of that; they only conjecture.

verses.verseString: وَإِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِمْ آيَاتُنَا بَيِّنَاتٍ مَا كَانَ حُجَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا أَنْ قَالُوا ائْتُوا بِآبَائِنَا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And when Our clear messages are recited to them, their only argument is that they say: Bring (back) our fathers, if you are truthful.

verses.verseString: قُلِ اللَّهُ يُحْيِيكُمْ ثُمَّ يُمِيتُكُمْ ثُمَّ يَجْمَعُكُمْ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهِ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَ النَّاسِ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Say: Allāh gives you life, then makes you die, then will He gather you to the day of Resurrection, wherein is no doubt, but most people know not.

verses.verseString: وَلِلَّهِ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ وَيَوْمَ تَقُومُ السَّاعَةُ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَخْسَرُ الْمُبْطِلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And Allāh’s is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. And on the day when the Hour comes to pass, on that day will the followers of falsehood perish.

verses.verseString: وَتَرَىٰ كُلَّ أُمَّةٍ جَاثِيَةً ۚ كُلُّ أُمَّةٍ تُدْعَىٰ إِلَىٰ كِتَابِهَا الْيَوْمَ تُجْزَوْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And thou wilt see every nation kneeling down. Every nation will be called to its record.ᵃ This day you are requited for what you did.

verses.verseString: هَٰذَا كِتَابُنَا يَنْطِقُ عَلَيْكُمْ بِالْحَقِّ ۚ إِنَّا كُنَّا نَسْتَنْسِخُ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: This is Our record that speaks against you with truth. Surely We wrote what you did.

verses.verseString: فَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ فَيُدْخِلُهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ فِي رَحْمَتِهِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ الْفَوْزُ الْمُبِينُ
verses.verseStringB: Then as to those who believed and did good, their Lord will admit them to His mercy. That is the manifest achievement.

verses.verseString: وَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَفَلَمْ تَكُنْ آيَاتِي تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ فَاسْتَكْبَرْتُمْ وَكُنْتُمْ قَوْمًا مُجْرِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And as to those who disbelieved — were not My messages recited to you? But you were proud and you were a guilty people.

verses.verseString: وَإِذَا قِيلَ إِنَّ وَعْدَ اللَّهِ حَقٌّ وَالسَّاعَةُ لَا رَيْبَ فِيهَا قُلْتُمْ مَا نَدْرِي مَا السَّاعَةُ إِنْ نَظُنُّ إِلَّا ظَنًّا وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُسْتَيْقِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And when it was said, Surely the promise of Allāh is true and the Hour — there is no doubt about it, you said: We know not what the Hour is. We think (it) only a conjecture and we are not at all sure.

verses.verseString: وَبَدَا لَهُمْ سَيِّئَاتُ مَا عَمِلُوا وَحَاقَ بِهِمْ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And the evil of what they did will become manifest to them, and that at which they mocked will encompass them.

verses.verseString: وَقِيلَ الْيَوْمَ نَنْسَاكُمْ كَمَا نَسِيتُمْ لِقَاءَ يَوْمِكُمْ هَٰذَا وَمَأْوَاكُمُ النَّارُ وَمَا لَكُمْ مِنْ نَاصِرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And it will be said: This day We forsake you as you neglected the meet ing of this day of yours, and your abode is the Fire, and you have no helpers.

verses.verseString: ذَٰلِكُمْ بِأَنَّكُمُ اتَّخَذْتُمْ آيَاتِ اللَّهِ هُزُوًا وَغَرَّتْكُمُ الْحَيَاةُ الدُّنْيَا ۚ فَالْيَوْمَ لَا يُخْرَجُونَ مِنْهَا وَلَا هُمْ يُسْتَعْتَبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: That is because you made the messages of Allāh a jest and the life of this world deceived you. So on that day they shall not be taken out of it, nor shall they be granted goodwill.

verses.verseString: فَلِلَّهِ الْحَمْدُ رَبِّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَرَبِّ الْأَرْضِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So praise be to Allāh, the Lord of the heavens and the Lord of the earth, the Lord of the worlds!

verses.verseString: وَلَهُ الْكِبْرِيَاءُ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ وَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: And to Him belongs greatness in the heavens and the earth; and He is the Mighty, the Wise.

footnotes.note:
6a. After Allåh and His signs, i.e., after the word of Allåh and His signs have cometo them.

14a. By the days of Allåh are meant the favours which are bestowed on the righteous; see 14:5a. These words make it clear that there is an assurance given to the faithful in the two previous verses that they will be triumphant in this world, and rule theland as well as the sea.

17a. The Affair or Amr here signifies the prophethood of Mu√ammad, regarding whichthe Israelites were given the clearest prophecies (Bd). See the next verse, where the HolyProphet is plainly addressed as having been given this Affair.

21a. The meaning may be that the wicked are not like the righteous, either in life or indeath; or, that the wicked will not find themselves in death in a state of ease resemblingthat which they enjoy in this life. Or, the doing of good is here called life, and the doing ofevil death, because good deeds give life to man and evil deeds cause his spiritual death.

23a. The word knowingly implies that Allåh knows the heart and mental attitude ofmen of low desires, and the consequence of their evil deeds is that they remain in error.

28a. That every nation shall have a book or a record of its deeds shows that nationsare also judged according to their deeds. But nations are judged in this life, therefore theday on which every nation is called to its record is the day of its doom. The words —thou wilt see every nation kneeling down — hint at a great spiritual awakening beingbrought about in the world.
